name: Signature Bank
description: ne of three banks whose ties to Kushner have been widely reported to be under review by New York banking regulators. The bank’s board members have included Ivanka Trump and former Republican U.S. senator Al D’Amato, a dealmaker and power broker in New York business and politics who has been a vocal supporter of President Trump.

stories.description: ne of three banks whose ties to Kushner have been widely reported to be under review by New York banking regulators. The bank’s board members have included Ivanka Trump and former Republican U.S. senator Al D’Amato, a dealmaker and power broker in New York business and politics who has been a vocal supporter of President Trump.
stories.headline: Cozy land deals meant big money for Trump family and friends

familyMemberEthics.description: Ivanka Trump owes $1,000,001 - $5,000,000 in revolving debt to Signature Bank. The Secured line of credit was incurred in 2016 at a rate of PRIME+0.5% ((4%F).

Ivanka Trump received $15,001 - $50,000 each in two separate transactions, and $5,001 - $15,000 and $100,001 - $1,000,000 in two additional transactions of Capital Gains income from SIGNATURE BANK NEW YORK NY the year before her appointment as her father's presidential adviser.

Jared Kushner holds both secured and unsecured lines of credit, each worth $1,000,001 - $5,000,000 in revolving debt, with Signature Bank. The unsecured line of credit liability, which he holds jointly with his father, was incurred in 2016 at a rate of PRIME+0.5% (4% F). The secured line of credit liability was incurred in 2016 at a rate of PRIME+0.5% (4% F). Jared Kushner received between $135,004 and $1,115,000 in Capital Gains income via four distributions from SIGNATURE BANK NEW YORK NY the year before his appointment as Pres. Trump’s senior adviser. Although the investment assets reportedly have been divested, this entry is marked as an “active” potential conflict of interest due to the active revolving credit line.
